item.title: Progress on Figuring out Hugo's template system
item.description: Today, finally I managed to get the page showing the way I originally envisioned. I wanted to have the links on the left sidebar to be the content from the /content/pages/ folder, while the list on the right (main) section on the home page to show only the pages from the /content/posts/ folder. Just like a regular blog. The trick lied in modifying two template files: layouts/_default/baseof.html and layouts/_default/list.html The first is the overall template for the whole site.

item.title: Getting Rusty
item.description: About 2 weeks ago, I read an article about the programming language Rust has won the most loved language in Stackoverflow survery for 2020. For 5 years in a row. It was about 5 years ago when I looked into Go (Golang) and at that time I read a bunch of comparisions between Go and Rust. And somehow, I didn’t end up trying it. Go was great and ended up building many tools with it.

item.title: Independence Day
item.description: Today is a my own personal Independence Day. Two years ago on this day, I started a new life. What lead up to this point is that I had a dream of making a difference in the world & gave up everything for it. But after a year, I had to realize that every one of my goals were thoroughly blocked and I was mired down in rules, regulations - written, spoken and un-spoken ones.

item.title: My Fist Post with Hugo
item.description: The first post with Hugo This Sunday morning I woke up early and I decided to try if I can put together a static website with Hugo and publish it with Github pages. I had been thinking about this for about a year now, since I read some articles about it. I’m very interested in making very fast loading sites, which are also simple under the hood. I also wanted to make a site where I can publish my thoughts without the noise of social networking sites.
